articles.headline: A Studio Head Slowly Alters the ‘Warner Way’
articles.snippet: Jeff Robinov, president of Warner Brothers Pictures, has quietly become one of the most powerful people in Hollywood. He may soon become more so.
articles.abstract: Jeff Robinov, president of Warner Brothers Pictures, has quietly become one of the most powerful people in Hollywood. He may soon become more so.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  Jeff Robinov, president of the Warner Brothers Pictures Group, arrived at the fashionable Tower Bar here on a recent weekend. Other members of Hollywood’s A-list were quickly ushered to tables in the dining room, but Mr. Robinov had to wait  and wait. He finally ordered off the bar menu.

articles.headline: Pakistan Is Said to Pursue Role in U.S.-Afghan Talks
articles.snippet: The offer is aimed at preserving Pakistan’s influence in Afghanistan once the Americans leave, and could both help and hurt American interests.
articles.abstract: The offer is aimed at preserving Pakistan’s influence in Afghanistan once the Americans leave, and could both help and hurt American interests.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistan has told the United States it wants a central role in resolving the Afghan war and has offered to mediate with Taliban factions who use its territory and have long served as its allies, American and Pakistani officials said.

articles.headline: Long-Term Care Hospitals Face Little Scrutiny
articles.snippet: Lawsuits, state inspections and federal statistics paint a troubling picture of the care offered at some hospitals.
articles.abstract: Lawsuits, state inspections and federal statistics paint a troubling picture of the care offered at some hospitals.
articles.lead_paragraph: No one at the hospital noticed that Tina Bell-Jackman was dying.

articles.headline: Safety Agency Scrutinized as Toyota Recall Grows
articles.snippet: Critics want to know why the agency that regulates automakers did not act more aggressively against Toyota.
articles.abstract: Critics want to know why the agency that regulates automakers did not act more aggressively against Toyota.
articles.lead_paragraph: In November, top auto safety officials made an unusual request of Transportation Secretary Ray LaHood. After reviewing complaints about Toyota vehicles, the regulators said they believed the automaker was stalling their inquiries and wanted to go to Japan to stress just how serious their concerns had become.
articles.byline: By Eric Lichtblau and Bill Vlasic

articles.headline: Fed to Reveal Its Strategy for Raising Interest Rates
articles.snippet: Ben S. Bernanke now faces the task of beginning to pull the Federal Reserve out of its extraordinary effort to prop up the economy.
articles.abstract: Ben S. Bernanke now faces the task of beginning to pull the Federal Reserve out of its extraordinary effort to prop up the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Ben S. Bernanke, having survived a surprising challenge to his second term as Federal Reserve chairman, now faces the delicate task of beginning to pull the central bank out of its extraordinary effort to prop up the economy.
